quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Letter and Person
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, traders, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Blagoevgrad BT is this countrys largest cigarette company. Kremikovtzi is its largest metalworking company. Mobiltel is one of its largest communications companies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bulgaria

questions.question: Which of these is considered the first supermarket in the USA?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Kullen

questions.question: Ross Perot, a very successful American business man, founded Electronic Data Systems. Which statement about him is untrue?

options.text: In 1968 he was called The Fastest, Richest Texan.
When two of his employees were taken captive by Iran, he sponsored a successful rescue of the two men.
He began as a salesman for IBM.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He  old EDS to IBM .

questions.question: In 2004 this Russian company, founded in 1989, accounted for about 93% of Russian natural gas production.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gazprom

questions.question: Which of these stores is the largest in terms of area?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harrods (London)

questions.question: Who is recognized as the first female millionaire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Breedlove

questions.question: Prior to 1837 if  you mailed a letter, the person receiving the letter had to pay for postage.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What did ATT announce in December, 2007?

options.text: It would accept  credit cards at payphones.
It would be called  US SouthWestern Bell.
It would raise payphones rates to $1 for the first minute.
It would eliminate all of its payphones by the end of 2008.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It would eliminate all of its payphones by the end of 2008.

questions.question: Who was the first person to have his face on a dollar bill?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Salmon P. Chase

questions.question: What was the first bank to manage over 2 trillion dollars?

options.text: Chase Manhattan Bank of New York

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: UBS AG of Switzerland

questions.question: Prior to this year, all American paper money came in varying sizes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1929

questions.question: In 1931citizens of Tenino, Washington agreed to use wooden coins.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Checks were probably used by Dutch traders as early as the 1400s. In what year were the first printed checks made?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1762

questions.question: The first bank with a drive through window was in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago, Illinois

questions.question: What is done to many coins so that unscrupulous people can not clip off part of  he coin to melt down?

options.text: Coins have special radioactive particles so that the pieced can be traced.
Coins are made of very malleable metals.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coins have milled  edges.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Maryland and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, colonies, marylands. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The state of Maryland has 23 counties.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When did the Dow Jones Industrial Average first hit 1,000?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1972

questions.question: Baltimore is the largest city in Maryland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of Marylands state nicknames?

options.text: Maryland does not have a state nickname.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Garden State

questions.question: What is Marylands state flower?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black-eyed Susan

questions.question: 442 is an area code of Maryland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Was Maryland the second state to ratify the United States Constitution?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: The highest point in Maryland is the Hoye Crest on Backbone Mountain, which is located in this county.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Garrett County

questions.question: Sears was founded in 1886 in Chicago, Illinois. Which of these Sears stores is the largest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toronto, Canada

questions.question: Baltimore is the capital of Maryland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The precursor of this company was founded by an employee of the US Census Bureau in 1896 in Broome County, New York.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: IBM

questions.question: Which county is the biggest in Maryland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frederick County

questions.question: What was the first of the American colonies to put E Pluribus Unum on coins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey

questions.question: What is Marylands state motto?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fatti Maschii, Parole Femine

questions.question: Which of the following states does not border Maryland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Philippines and Nickname
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, nickname, nicknames. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the official residence of the President of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Malcañang Palace

questions.question: What is the nickname of the U.S. state of Oklahoma?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Land of the Red Man

questions.question: One of the nicknames of the U.S. state of Georgia is derived from the name of this fruit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peach

questions.question: Who is the second female president of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gloria Macapal Arroyo

questions.question: Which U.S. state has been nicknamed The Friendship State?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas

questions.question: Manuel L. Quezon is the first President of the Commonwealth of the Philippines.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Pangulo is the Filipino term for President.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who is the seventh President of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ramon Magsaysay

questions.question: Who is the first President of the independent Republic of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manuel Roxas

questions.question: The U.S. state of South Carolina used to be known by this nickname.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iodine Products State

questions.question: Who is the thirteenth President of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph Estrada

questions.question: Who is considered the first President of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emilio Aguinaldo

questions.question: Who is the first female President of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Corazon Aquino

questions.question: Who is the Philippine President whose term ended up because of People Power?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ferdinand Marcos

questions.question: Which U.S. state is known by the nickname The Gem State?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Idaho

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Love and Nickname
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, nickname, aviator. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What nickname has been given to the U.S. state of Ohio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Birthplace of Aviation

questions.question: What famous French author and WWII aviator made the following statement about love: Life has taught us that love does not consist in gazing at each other but in looking outward together in the same direction.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

questions.question: What is the nickname of the U.S. state of New Jersey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Garden State

questions.question: What species of bird does the term lovebird refer to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: parrot

questions.question: The name Valentine, which was very popular in Late Antiquity, is derived from the Latin word valens. What does it mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: strong, powerful

questions.question: Which U.S. state has been nicknamed The Mother of Presidents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia

questions.question: During the prohibition era a conflict between two powerful criminal gangs resulted in what came to be known as the Saint Valentines Day massacre. In what US city did it occur?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: Vinegar valentines, ostensibly given on Valentines Day, became popular during the Victorian era. What type of message do they contain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: insult

questions.question: What is the occupation of Ashton Kutchers character, Reed Bennett, in Garry Marshalls 2010 romantic comedy Valentines Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: florist

questions.question: In modern times, the heart is the symbol representing love. What other organ was considered to be the seat of love and emotion in ancient times and in the Middle Ages?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: liver

questions.question: What interesting nickname was given to the U.S. state of Florida?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gods Waiting Room

questions.question: In Sleepless in Seattle, Meg Ryans character impulsively writes a letter to Sam Baldwin (Tom Hanks) suggesting that he meet her on top of the Empire State Building on Valentines Day. What classic romantic movie inspired Sleepless in Seattle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An Affair to Remember

questions.question: What is the nickname of the U.S. state of Indiana?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hospitality State

questions.question: In Roman mythology, Cupid is the god of desire, affection and erotic love. Who is his Greek counterpart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eros

questions.question: The first recorded association of Valentines Day with romantic love is found in the poem Parlement of Foules (Parliament of Fowls), written by this medieval English author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Geoffrey Chaucer

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Following and Connecticut
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, title, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name the longest river entirely in England, which flows through London, Oxford, Reading and Richmond.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thames

questions.question: Name the English captain who claimed California for Queen Elizabeth I in 1579.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Francis Drake

questions.question: Who is known as a Beefeater?

options.text: someone who prepares the Queens food
a person who guards the Tower of London
someone who tastes the Queens food
a person who guards Buckingham Palace

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a person who guards the Tower of London

questions.question: Among the not so glorious firsts from Connecticut was the first traitor of the United States. What was his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benedict Arnold

questions.question: What tragic Shakesperean heroine spoke the following words in her mad ramblings:

options.text: d I a maid at your window,

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ophelia

questions.question: What London department store was sold by Mohamed Al-Fayed to Qatar Holdings in 2010?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harrods

questions.question: Which of the following is nicknamed The Old Lady of Threadneedle Street?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Bank of England

questions.question: The first woman to be elected governor, in her own right, was from Connecticut. Name her.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ella Grasso

questions.question: Connecticut is called The Constitution State because the first written state constitution was penned there. What is the name of that constitution?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fundamental Orders

questions.question: Who lives at 10 Downing Street, London, colloquially known in the United Kingdom as Number 10?

options.text: the Heir Apparent to the throne

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the British Prime Minister

questions.question: Yorkshire pudding, a dish that originated in Yorkshire, England, is usually served with which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: roast meat

questions.question: Name the man from New Haven who invented the cotton gin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eli Whitney

questions.question: The flag of which country incorporates a red dragon as well as the Tudor colours of green and white?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wales

questions.question: Haggis is a traditional Scottish dish, typically associated with this celebration.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burns Night

questions.question: Who of the following wasnt granted the title Prince of Wales?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George VI

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Connecticut and Philippines
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, printers, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Connecticuts state hero is Nathan Hale. Who is the state heroine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prudence Crandall

questions.question: What did Spanish invaders call Pygmies, the aborigines of the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Negritos

questions.question: Who introduced duck breeding in the Philippines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Japanese

questions.question: What is the typical Tagalog love song called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: kundiman

questions.question: Which of these is among the accomplishments of P.T. Barnum, who was born in Bethel, Connecticut?

options.text: Staging the first three ring circus
Bringing Jenny Lind to America (the Swedish Nightingale)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the typical Visayan love song called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: balitaw

questions.question: During Spanish times Philippine foreign trade with Spain was carried out through this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mexico

questions.question: Which of the following originated in Connecticut?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hamburger

questions.question: What did ancient Filipinos call the supreme being in which they believed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bathala

questions.question: Which of the following was not invented in Connecticut?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Electric light

questions.question: In which Connecticut city was the first telephone exchange in the U.S. established?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Haven

questions.question: Who was known as Prince of Filipino Printers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tomas Pinpin

questions.question: Name the oldest amusement park in the U.S. which is located in Bristol, Connecticut.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lake Compounce

questions.question: What Spanish navigator first used the name Las Islas Filipinas (The Philippine Islands)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roy Lopez de Villalobos

questions.question: Which of these was the head of the Philippine government during the Spanish period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: governor-general
